div.para: @content: Accepts either "file" or "text". When content is "file", the element's text value is treated as a PATH to a file, whereas when it is "text", the element's text value is interpreted as the raw text to use for creating a file. The default value is "file".
The kickstart file is used by Anaconda, the CentOS system installer, for obtaining options, such as language, timezone, network and machine configuration, during automated installation.

For more information on creating and using kickstart files, see the CentOS Studio User Manual. In addition, the chapter on Kickstart Installations in the Red Hat Enterprise Linux Installation Guide provides complete details on available kickstart parameters.
div.note: It is not necessary to specify a '%packages' section in the kickstart file. CentOS Studio automatically configures the installer to install all packages in the solution. If a '%packages' section is provided, it is ignored.

div.para: If the ssh attribute is TRUE, CentOS Studio attempts to copy the script to the specified host and execute it from the /etc/sysconfig/centosstudio/ folder with root privileges.
If the ssh attribute is FALSE, CentOS Studio relies on the script to perform all steps to connect, authenticate, and execute the script on one or more host machines.
